addressleaf.section:
To LL. of
[
e Councell May]
31. 90

page.lettertext:
fol.171r
Belgia: 1590. May:
[.]
1590 31 May To
e L
s
of the Councell
It may please y
r
LL to be adv
r
tised,
t
this bearer
M
r
Browne
havinge brought y
r
LL l
re
to
e
g
n
all States
in favo
r
of his cause
the same hath bin refered to
e
Councell of State
, by whom yt
hath bin ordred, that in lieu of those Capt
s
billes, that hee
p
n
ted unto them, being in
e paie of those countrys hee should
receave to
e selfe same vallew
e billes of oth
r
capt
s
, w
ch
were
under
e paie of
her Ma
tye
. & wh
r
as there are certain bills of those
w
ch
hee delivered, that are for vittailes Rxd after
e 12 of October
A
o.
86. the Counsell of State doth alleadge
t
those are belonging
to her Ma
tes
tie
For manifestation wh
r
of they have deliverd to
M
r
Browne, the copie of an ordinance made by my
L. of Leicester
&
e Councell of State to
t
effect. And this is their finall
resolution for
e paiement of such sommes as they did owe unto him
wherin I have not failed, as y
r
LL. required to assist him what I
might, & to intreat
e same
tie
t
e debt might be payd in
redy mony, or els contentement given to his credito
rs
in these countreys.
But I may daily
ceave there want of meanes & besides they
ar affraied
t
would tourne to theyr prejudice, in respect of
ma
[ny] [.]
hers, w
ch
might presse th
e
here after to
e like satisfaction
[.]
though
e requeste to adv
r
tise yo
r
LL. &c
I take my
humble leave. May. 31. 90.
